image.altText: Clare O'Neil

props.synopsis: Australians are warned to stay vigilant as scammers and hackers try to capitalise on Friday's global tech crash.

title.children: Scammers will pounce on global tech outage, home affairs minister warns

image.altText: A Windows PC shwing a "Blue Screen of Death" error.

props.synopsis: Friday afternoon felt frighteningly similar to the 12-minute mark in a disaster movie. The difference is that in the movie, a villain is pulling the strings, but in reality, the culprit was far closer to home.

title.children: The global tech crash opened like a Hollywood disaster film. So, how does it end?

image.altText: People move around below a blank sign in a Berlin airport

props.synopsis: Seemingly all at once, millions of computers around the world became unusable and unable to be rebooted, showing what's known in the industry as the "Blue Screen of Death".

title.children: How a bug in a little-known piece of software caused a global meltdown

image.altText: A handwritten sign on a shop window that says: system down, sorry!!! in black marker

props.synopsis: One configuration file that updates multiple times a day was the cause behind a system crash that spread worldwide.

title.children: Channel File 291: The tiny update that caused a global IT outage

image.altText: SAS soldier overlooks valley in Afghanistan as Black Hawk helicopter flies past in 2012.

props.synopsis: The Australian government has laid out how it will compensate the families of people found to have been unlawfully killed or abused by Australian special forces in Afghanistan.

title.children: Defence takes 'significant step forward' to compensate for unlawful Afghanistan killings

image.altText: Stacey and Nathaniel Train on their wedding day, with Nathaniel's brother Gareth.

props.synopsis: Background Briefing can reveal that Australia's first alleged Christian terrorists forged their fateful bond years ago following an explosive family rift.

title.children: 'Bewildered': Trio made shocking allegations against parents years before deadly ambush

image.altText: An altered mugshot shows the mysterious Hamas military commander Mohammed Deif, who is known as The Guest.

props.synopsis: A leading Hamas military commander in Gaza has survived multiple Israeli attempts to kill him, but after a recent massive strike on what Israeli military said was a militant compound, they may have finally gotten their man — now all they need is evidence.

title.children: Israel has tried to assassinate 'The Guest' seven times. Here's how his luck may have finally run out

image.altText: Close up of sign saying Unley Oval

props.synopsis: "Misinformation" and community "division" — it sounds like the latest report about the upcoming American presidential election. In fact it's a sleepy suburb in Adelaide's inner-south where a proposal to build a fence has ignited online fury.

title.children: 'Storm in teacup' erupts over council proposal to return fencing to home of Double Blues

image.altText: Stills of video which played a role in the Australian's four month investigation

props.synopsis: The Australian Competition and Consumer Commission (ACCC) discontinues its investigation into "white hands on black art" allegations at the APY Arts Centre Collective (APY CCC), saying it has found nothing to suggest consumer law has been breached.

title.children: ACCC finds no consumer law breached in 'white hands on black art' allegations

image.altText: Donald Trump, wearing a bandage on his ear, pumps his fist and walks off stage

props.synopsis: Seven days ago, a defiant Joe Biden was refusing calls to withdraw from this year's election while Donald Trump prepared for a huge rally ahead of the Republican National Convention. And then everything changed.

title.children: This week will go down as a chaotic chapter in US political history. What just happened?

image.altText: a person wearing jackets walks on a snow-covered mountain at Ben Lomond National Park, Northern Tasmania.

props.synopsis: A cold front moving across south-eastern states is dumping snow, with strong, damaging winds bringing down trees and power lines.

title.children: Hazardous weather across Australia's south-east dumps snow, brings damaging winds

image.altText: JD Vance smiles, raises his left hand places his right hand over his heart as he walks out on a stage.

props.synopsis: The CFMEU's history gives us a window into Australia's economic, political and industrial landscape over the past 40 years.

title.children: The history of the CFMEU weirdly sheds light on JD Vance and our upcoming 'critical decade'

image.altText: Chinese officials sitting in front of communist symbol in a conference.

props.synopsis: The conclusion of the Chinese Communist Party's 20th Third Plenum marks a significant moment in Chinese politics, as Xi Jinping appears to be laying the groundwork for an unprecedented fourth term.

title.children: Xi Jinping prepares for a fourth term, sets the course for China's economy for the next decade

image.altText: a boy and a girl smile at camera in front of a swimming pool wearing South Australia jumpers

props.synopsis: Young swimmers in Kyle Chalmers' home town are drawing plenty of inspiration from the Olympic medallist as they dive in for training on cold winter mornings.

title.children: Port Lincoln kids gun for hometown hero Kyle Chalmers' records as Games excitement builds

image.altText: Jamarra Ugle-Hagan celebrates an AFL goal for the Bulldogs.

props.synopsis: The Bulldogs roar home in the final quarter to complete a 47-point win over the Cats, while the Power are back inside the top eight after defeating the Tigers by 41 points.

title.children: Bulldogs conquer Cats in the wet, Power prevail against plucky Tigers

image.altText: A woman stands on the side of a dirt road near buildings and flashing a V-sign with her fingers at a military vehicle driving by

props.synopsis: The world's highest court issues an opinion that describes Israel's actions as a breach of the Geneva Convention and other international law.

title.children: Top UN court says Israeli occupation of Palestinian territories is illegal

image.altText: Joe Biden looks straight ahead with stern expression, holding one hand in a balled up fist

props.synopsis: Joe Biden is insistent on staying in the presidential race, despite a growing thrum of concern among senior Democrats who say he may not be able to defeat Donald Trump in the 2024 election.

title.children: Biden campaign insists he will stay in presidential race, amid growing calls to stand down

image.altText: Protesters on the street.

props.synopsis: Bangladesh announces a nationwide curfew and the deployment of military forces after police failed to quell days of deadly unrest spreading throughout the country.

title.children: Bangladesh imposes curfew, calls in military as 105 die in student-led protests

image.altText: A map showing Australia with pins/

props.synopsis: Over the last 120 years, Australia's population has become more diverse, increasingly urbanised, older and less likely to have children. That's according to new demographic data issued by the Australian Bureau of Statistics.

title.children: Twelve charts that show how Australia's population changed over 120 years

image.altText: A woman wearing a traditional Indian outfit drinking a glass of champagne

props.synopsis: How do you sum up the experiences of Australia's second-largest migrant population in one book? Growing Up Indian In Australia editor Aarti Betigeri speaks on the dangers of assuming all Indians had the same upbringing.

title.children: How do you sum up the experiences of Australia's second-largest population group in one book?

image.altText: A man wearing a cap makes a coffee in a coffee shop.

props.synopsis: As industry experts continue to grapple with how a suspected defect in a computer update brought the world to a halt, Australians recount how the incident unfolded.

title.children: 'At least the coffee shop's open': Australians' 'frustrating' Friday amid IT outage

image.altText: Scientists open an octopus.

props.synopsis: School-age, university students and keen members of the public have gathered to observe a rare public dissection of a 140kg octopus squid found off South Australia's Eyre Peninsula.

title.children: 'Exceptionally rare' octopus squid dissected by researchers at SA university

image.altText: A young person wearing a hood and beanie sits with their head in their hands against a brick wall.

props.synopsis: Current and former staff of a Victorian high school say they feel unsupported as they face abuse, stalking and feelings of dread in their roles.

title.children: Nightmares, headaches, crying in the car: College staff describe impact of 'unsafe' work environment

image.altText: man in military outfit with red hat raises fist while speaking into a dozen plus microhpnes

props.synopsis: Yemen's Houthi rebels claim to have hit and damaged a Singapore-flagged container ship with two missiles, while the Israeli army reviews an earlier blast in central Tel Aviv, as the Houthis escalate attacks on global shipping.

title.children: Yemen Houthis damage cargo ship in Gulf of Aden as militants step up attacks

image.altText: elderly man and woman sitting on couch smiling

props.synopsis: Social interactions and community connection are often some of the first things people living with dementia lose.

title.children: Memory cafes ease loneliness for people living with dementia

image.altText: A woman wearing a hat smiling next to a fence with a toddler sitting on the fence and a baby on her hip

props.synopsis: It was Kerry O'Sullivan's goal to run the family's 36,000-hectare cattle property, but her other dream was to be a mum. She watched on as her close friends became mothers, but at 35 she still hadn't met the right person.

title.children: Kerry always wanted to be a mum. Being a single grazier didn't stop her from having IVF babies

image.altText: A suburban street in Sydney's inner-west

props.synopsis: The man was found with multiple stab wounds outside a home in Concord and died at the scene.

title.children: Teenager charged with murder after man in 30s dies from stab wounds in Sydney's inner-west

image.altText: Man in blue coat walking behind man in tan coat and scarf with stone building behind them.

props.synopsis: After telling police officers in his home that "relationships will obviously have their moments where there's tension", a Tasmanian supreme court judge found himself charged with assault and emotional abuse or intimidation.

title.children: How a judge became the judged, from the moment police knocked on his front door

image.altText: A pile of tablets with embossed numbers and letters sits on a dark surface

props.synopsis: SA Health is warning of the life-threatening dangers of a synthetic opioid after an Adelaide man almost died in hospital when he consumed a single street-purchased oxycodone pill last week.

title.children: 'This drug can kill you in a tablet': Warnings over potentially deadly synthetic opioid

image.altText: Julie Critchley and her husband next to a Mockingbird sign

props.synopsis: A foster care program that links up parents to create an extended family-like environment has helped improve carer retention and created better placement stability for children — with the program's facilitator now looking to further expand the program across the country.

title.children: 'Blend like cousins': Mockingbird foster program mimics extended family

image.altText: A female crayfish stretches its claws and had  eggs under its tail like little red berries

props.synopsis: The species has been mostly absent from the South Australian stretch of the river for around 40 years. Now, the population is getting another boost.

title.children: Once extinct Murray crayfish on track to 'thrive again' in SA's River Murray

image.altText: Jessica Mauboy wearing a light green jumpsuit sitting down against a dark green background, long hair, hand on chin

props.synopsis: When Jessica Mauboy's family gathered for a reunion, their family tree expanded to include one of Australia's most famous Olympians.

title.children: The family reunion that uncovered a link between Jessica Mauboy and Cathy Freeman

image.altText: Beef, broccoli and chilli stir fry with spring onions in a fry pan, ready to serve and eat.

props.synopsis: It's easy to make beef and broccoli at home, and this version includes chilli and sesame. Buttery, garlic rice makes it even more delicious.

title.children: Love beef and broccoli? This version has chilli, sesame and buttery garlic rice

image.altText: Graves at Fromelles, France following the infamous battle of July 1916

props.synopsis: The remains of 70 Australian WWI soldiers found in a mass grave at Fromelles are still to be identified. On the anniversary of the bloody battle they died in, a volunteer organisation is asking for help and DNA to give them back their names.

title.children: DNA detective work could end the mystery of 70 unknown diggers killed in Fromelles horror

image.altText: Four young people scoop curry and rice out of pots and bowls.

props.synopsis: With an uncertain future in rentals and campus accommodation, these Canberra students have turned to co-operative living.

title.children: In one of Australia's most expensive cities, Ben pays just $187 a week in rent after embracing co-operative housing
